summary: This document is a chain of emails from September 2019 between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel and other parties, coordinating a follow-up call to discuss Jeffrey Epstein's conduct and property in New Mexico. The emails show scheduling efforts for a call concerning an ongoing investigation.

persons.name: Gerson, Jonathon
persons.context: Copied on an email chain regarding scheduling a follow-up call about Epstein's New Mexico conduct and property.

persons.name: Epstein, Jeffrey
persons.context: The subject of the planned follow-up call concerning his conduct and property in New Mexico.

connections.description: Gerson is part of the U.S. Attorney's Office team involved in scheduling a call to discuss an investigation into Epstein's New Mexico activities.

events.title: Scheduled Follow-Up Call on Epstein's New Mexico Matters
events.description: A call is scheduled for September 12, 2019, at 3:30 ET to discuss Jeffrey Epstein's conduct and property in New Mexico.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein's conduct and property in New Mexico as of September 2019.
A follow-up call on the matter was scheduled for September 12, 2019, at 3:30 ET.
The email chain shows coordination between legal personnel, indicating an ongoing official inquiry.
The correspondence is dated after Epstein's arrest in July 2019, showing post-arrest investigative activity.
The tone suggests the matter was not considered 'urgent' but required formal discussion.
